meanings.definition: The condition or quality of being dimorphic.
meanings.sent1: The dimorphisms of the butterflies fascinated the students in biology class.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the dimorphisms in plants to understand their reproductive strategies.
meanings.sent3: The dimorphisms in the clownfish population led to some confusion among marine biologists.
meanings.sent4: The dimorphisms in the bird species were like a secret code waiting to be deciphered.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used colorful illustrations to explain the concept of dimorphisms to the students.

meanings.definition: The existence of two distinct forms within a single species.
meanings.sent1: The dimorphisms of the male and female peacocks are strikingly different.
meanings.sent2: Biologists observed interesting dimorphisms in the frogs living near the pond.
meanings.sent3: The dimorphisms in the squirrel population made it challenging for researchers to track their movements.
meanings.sent4: The dimorphisms in the flower petals created a beautiful contrast in the garden.
meanings.sent5: Children were amazed by the dimorphisms of the caterpillars transforming into butterflies.
